extendedIngredients.name: asparagus
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 ½ Cups Asparagus, broken into large pieces

extendedIngredients.name: capers
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ tsp Capers, plus additional for garnish

extendedIngredients.name: feta cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ Cup Reduced-fat Feta cheese, crumbled

extendedIngredients.name: oil packed sun dried tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tsps Oil from a jar of oil-packed sun dried tomatoes

extendedIngredients.name: red onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ Cup Red onion, roughly chopped

extendedIngredients.name: roasted red peppers
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¾ Cup Roasted red peppers from a jar, sliced * (About 1 ½ full peppers)

extendedIngredients.name: sun dried tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 Tbsp Sun dried-tomatoes, roughly chopped, plus additional for garnish. (optional)

recipes.title: Grilled Mediterranean Vegetable Salad with Tomato Balsamic Vinaigrette

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Salad. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. The Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 35 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Aromas of apricot, guava and pineapple juice mingle with hints of sweet vanilla and warm toasty notes.

recipes.instructions: 1. Add the sliced roasted red pepper, asparagus, sliced zucchini and chopped red onion into a large bowl.2. In a small bowl, whisk together the ¼ cup Balsamic vinegar, 2 tsps oil and pinch of salt and pepper. Pour over the vegetables, mixing well.  Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.3. Once the vegetables have marinated, preheat your grill to medium/high heat and place a grill basket on top.4. Place the vegetables into the grill basket, reserving the balsamic vinegar mixture.  Cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly charred.5. While the vegetables grill, combine the reserved Balsamic Vinegar mixture with ½ tsp capers, ½ tsp garlic and sun dried tomatoes in a small food processor. Process until well combined (you may still have some small tomato chunks – this is fine.)6. Place the grilled veggies in a bowl and toss with the balsamic vinaigrette. Garnish with additional sun dried tomatoes, capers, crumbled feta cheese and fresh basil.

steps.step: Add the sliced roasted red pepper, asparagus, sliced zucchini and chopped red onion into a large bowl.2. In a small bowl, whisk together the ¼ cup Balsamic vinegar, 2 tsps oil and pinch of salt and pepper.

Pour over the vegetables, mixing well.  Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.3. Once the vegetables have marinated, preheat your grill to medium/high heat and place a grill basket on top.4.

Place the vegetables into the grill basket, reserving the balsamic vinegar mixture.  Cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly charred.5. While the vegetables grill, combine the reserved Balsamic Vinegar mixture with ½ tsp capers, ½ tsp garlic and sun dried tomatoes in a small food processor. Process until well combined (you may still have some small tomato chunks – this is fine.)6.
Place the grilled veggies in a bowl and toss with the balsamic vinaigrette.
Garnish with additional sun dried tomatoes, capers, crumbled feta cheese and fresh basil.
